summary: This is an email from Assistant U.S. Attorney A. Marie Villafaña to Jack Goldberger, transmitting a letter regarding victim notification in the Epstein case. It appears to be official legal correspondence related to the prosecution.

persons.name: Jack Goldberger
persons.context: Addressed as "Mr. Goldberger" in an email from a federal prosecutor regarding victim notification in the Epstein case.

persons.name: A. Marie Villafaña
persons.context: Author of the email, sending a letter about victim notification to Jack Goldberger from the U.S. Attorney's Office in West Palm Beach.

connections.description: Villafaña, as a federal prosecutor, is sending official legal correspondence (a victim notification letter) to Goldberger.

events.title: Victim Notification Correspondence
events.description: Assistant U.S. Attorney A. Marie Villafaña emails Jack Goldberger, attaching a letter regarding victim notification in the Epstein case.

locations: 500 S. Australian Ave, Suite 400, West Palm Beach, FL 33401
keyFacts: On July 8, 2008, federal prosecutor A. Marie Villafaña corresponded with Jack Goldberger regarding victim notification in the Epstein case.
The correspondence originated from the U.S. Attorney's Office in West Palm Beach, Florida, indicating active federal prosecution activity there in 2008.
The email transmits an attached letter (080708_Goldberger_Ltr_re_Victim_Notification.pdf), suggesting formal legal procedures for notifying victims were underway.
